greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sequence based on the pattern [3n, 3n, 3n, 3n+2, 3n+1, 3n+2].
comment: Powers of 2 in a scaled version of the Hankel transform of A106191.
link: M. F. Hasler, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,1,1,0,-1).
formula: a(n) = Sum_{i=0..floor(n/2)} (2n-i mod 3). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Mar 22 2016
maple: A137719:=n->add(2*n-i mod 3, i=0..floor(n/2)): seq(A137719(n), n=0..100); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Mar 21 2016
mathematica: Table[Sum[Mod[2 n - i, 3], {i, 0, Floor[n/2]}], {n, 0, 80}] (* _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Mar 21 2016 *)
program: (MAGMA) [&+[(2*n-i) mod 3: i in [0..Floor(n/2)]]: n in [0..80]]; // _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Mar 21 2016
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Feb 08 2008
